lines:
1956

September 23, 2.914.

Mr. S. S. Kwan 
Yale Station

New Haven, Conn.

May dear Kwan:

I am inclosing herewith correspondence which I have attempted

to hold with you during the sumer.

You will see from this that your

earlier letter reached me and that I did my best to comply with your request.

way my lettor did not reach you in San Francisco I don't know.

It has only

just come back to the office.

Your postal card with its cheery greeting reached me several days

ago, and the boys, whom I met in Boston with ir. Tsur and lir. Yong, told ne

of your presence in this country and your present whereabouts.

I nost

sincerely hope that you are going to be able to make us at least a short

visit before you begin the work at New Haven.

I want to see you badly.

If you don't get up this way I shall take the first opportunity to look

you up when in New Haven myself.

With kindest regards and best wishes to you, as always, believe

me,

Very sincerely yours,
raw: 1956 September 23, 2.914. Mr. S. S. Kwan Yale Station New Haven, Conn. May dear Kwan: I am inclosing herewith correspondence which I have attempted to hold with you during the sumer. You will see from this that your earlier letter reached me and that I did my best to comply with your request. way my lettor did not reach you in San Francisco I don't know. It has only just come back to the office. Your postal card with its cheery greeting reached me several days ago, and the boys, whom I met in Boston with ir. Tsur and lir. Yong, told ne of your presence in this country and your present whereabouts. I nost sincerely hope that you are going to be able to make us at least a short visit before you begin the work at New Haven. I want to see you badly. If you don't get up this way I shall take the first opportunity to look you up when in New Haven myself. With kindest regards and best wishes to you, as always, believe me, Very sincerely yours,

metadata.name: Phillips Academy
metadata.abstract: Letter enclosing correspondence that was returned from San Francisco and stating that he is not sure why the letters did not reach Kwan. Stearns received Kwan's post card from and he heard from boys traveling with Mr. Tsur and Mr. Wong about Kwan's presence in this country and in New Haven . Stearns invites Kwan to Andover.
metadata.collection: Head of School (Stearns) correspondence with Chinese alumni
